drake_specification

Lukas Huber

2020-7-31, last update (2021-04-03)

Source: vignettes/drake_specification.Rmd
drake_specification.Rmd

This template demonstrates traceability of a drake plan as a sequence of execution steps.

First the setup chunk sets the path to the project root - to conviently work with reproducible file-paths in headless and rstudio modes.

knitr::opts_knit$set(root.dir = rprojroot::find_rstudio_root_file())

This code sources the current projects files - packages required, functions required and the base drake plans.

source("R/packages.R")
## The following packages were not previously loaded:
## reproducibleFairTemplate
source("R/functions.R")
source("R/plan.R")

The first line of the following chunk forces a re-run of the whole drake workflow - comment it to see, if drake validates the current step.

drake::clean()
drake::make(plan)
## ▶ target raw_data
## ▶ target data
vis_drake_graph(plan)

Mandrake

Mandrake allows us to annotate and advance the documentation of a drake graph.

lookup_cache <- mandrake::load_package_colspec("mandrake")
## Adding cols from mandrake to lookup cache
## Including mandrake.yaml in lookup cache
cache <- drake::drake_cache()
plan_extracted <- plan %>%
  mandrake::decorate_plan(cache=cache, 
                          lookup_cache = lookup_cache,
                          desc_colname = "desc")
my_config <- drake_config(plan_extracted)
graph_info <- drake_graph_info(
  my_config, 
  group = "cluster_id", 
  clusters = c("summ", "coef"), 
  build_times = "none",
  on_select_col = "desc")
## Warning: argument config is deprecated. Use ... to supply make() arguments such
## as the plan instead.
graph <- render_drake_graph(
  graph_info, 
  on_select = mandrake::embed_event_handler(),
  ncol_legend = 4
  ) 
## Warning: `embed_event_handler()` was deprecated in mandrake 1.0.0.
## Please use `attach_dependencies()` instead.
## calling embed_event_handler from R is DEPRECATED due to lacking sanitization for XSS attacks
## the built-in JS deps + functions may be loaded usingmandrake::attach_dependencies().and use drake::render_graph(on_select = "embed_event_handler") to access this function.
## If you implement your own selection handler, mandrake::attach_dependencies() imports the JS package DOMPurify
## You are strongly advised to use DOMPurify to sanitize any HTML you render.
## to load other external JS deps, use htmltools::htmlDependency().
graph

Buidling of the analytic package

This section considers the build steps involved in the development and extension of an analysis.

First - be sure to document your package using roxygen with the following chunk.

#devtools::document()
#renv::snapshot()

Version_control

In order to look into the git commit history from R - one can use the gert library to see what happened.

library(gert)
git_log()
git_status()
